# About Sails
##### The Sails framework was developed by Mike McNeil to assist his team in building scalable Node.js projects for startup and enterprise customers. Since its release in 2012, Sails has become one of the most widely-used web application frameworks in the world.
## The company
The Sails Company was founded by the original author and maintainers of the Sails framework. In addition to free and open-source software, The Sails Company offers a [full-service web & mobile studio](https://sailsjs.com/</studio>) and [professional support](https://sailsjs.com/</flagship>) for the tools we maintain. Our close-knit team consists of experienced engineers and product people who can assist with everything from strategy, to interface design, to architecture and implementation. Specialties include advanced UIs, realtime technologies like WebSockets, and modern enterprise-grade web and mobile applications. 
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/team_mike@2x.jpeg) [Mike McNeil](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/github.com/mikermcneil>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/team_kelvin.png) [Kelvin Omereshone](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/github.com/DominusKelvin>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/team_eric@2x.jpg) [Eric Shaw](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/github.com/eashaw>)
## Our philosophy
We aim to improve the day to day experience of server-side development, and make it more accessible to people of all experience levels and backgrounds. Above all, we strive to help developers build their apps more efficiently, and with less risk. But we’re also committed to providing high-quality tools, services, and educational resources that make server-side development more transparent— so that [someday](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=nZKG7hLhbRs>), anyone who can understand basic backend concepts can build an app.
## What we do
The Sails Company is the primary sponsor of the Sails framework and related open-source projects, such as Waterline, Skipper, and the Node Machine specification. We develop frameworks and tools that empower JavaScript developers to reach new levels of productivity, and we provide professional services and [support](https://sailsjs.com/</flagship>) to make the process of Node.js development dramatically faster and easier for organizations.
If you are interested in hiring us for a (realistically-funded) project, [drop us a line](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/sailsjs.com/contact>).
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/about_sails@2x.png) [Sails](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/github.com/balderdashy/sails>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/about_waterline@2x.png) [Waterline](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/github.com/balderdashy/waterline>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/about_treeline@2x.png) [Treeline IDE](https://sailsjs.com/<https:/techcrunch.com/2015/03/11/treeline-wants-to-take-the-coding-out-of-building-a-backend/>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/about_nodemachine@2x.png) [Node Machine](https://sailsjs.com/<http:/node-machine.org>)
![](https://sailsjs.com/images/logo_sails@2x.png)
#### Built with Love
The Sails framework is built by a [web & mobile shop in Austin, TX](https://sailsjs.com/</about>), with the help of our contributors. We created Sails in 2012 to assist us on Node.js projects. Naturally we open-sourced it. We hope it makes your life a little bit easier!

**Sails Co. Overview**

Founded by the creators of the Sails framework, Sails Co. started life as The Sails Company. Hailing from Austin, Texas, this tiny but mighty firm—comprising just four dedicated employees—has carved out a niche as a full-service web, mobile, and cloud studio. They've got a solid footing in the open-source realm, advocating for efficient server-side development with their well-regarded framework launched back in 2012. The company notably participated in Y Combinator’s Winter 2015 batch, solidifying their startup credentials.

**Mission and Services**

Sails Co. aims to make server-side development more accessible while boosting productivity for developers of all levels. They offer not just a robust open-source framework but also professional support services that assist clients in achieving their project goals with reduced risk. Their specialties include advanced user interfaces and real-time technologies, making them a go-to for modern enterprise applications.

**Key Offerings:**
- **Open-Source Frameworks:** Sails, Waterline, and more.
- **Professional Services:** Consultation, design, architecture, and implementation tailored to specific needs.
- **Educational Resources:** They are committed to enriching the developer community through high-quality resources and support.

**Philosophy and Vision**

These folks believe in improving the day-to-day experience of developers. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting your journey, Sails Co. fosters an environment where anyone acquainted with basic backend concepts can learn to build applications—democratizing the power of software development.

For those interested in collaborating or hiring their team for a project, Sails Co. encourages reaching out directly.

**Conclusion**

To sum it up, Sails Co. combines a rich heritage in open-source software with a contemporary service-oriented approach, making them a beacon for JavaScript developers looking to harness the power of Node.js efficiently. If you want to know more about them, head over to their website at [sailsjs.com](https://sailsjs.com/about).
